definitions.definition: To direct or be in charge of.
examples: Even though Jack is a novice, he manages his team with great success.

definitions.definition: To handle or control (a situation , job ).
examples: The government managed the inflation very poorly.

definitions.definition: To handle with skill , wield (a tool , weapon etc.).
To succeed at an attempt in spite of difficulty .
examples: He managed to climb the tower.

subdefinitions.definition: To end up doing something that could or should have been avoided .
examples: She somehow managed to sit on the wet paint.

definitions.definition: To achieve (something) without fuss , or without outside help .
examples: It's a tough job, but I'll manage .

definitions.definition: To manage to say; to say while fighting back embarrassment , laughter , etc.
To train (a horse ) in the manège ; to exercise in graceful or artful action .
To treat with care ; to husband .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To direct or be in charge of.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To handle or control (a situation , job ).
( transitive ) To handle with skill , wield (a tool , weapon etc.).
( intransitive ) To succeed at an attempt in spite of difficulty . [ with infinitive ]
( ambitransitive ) To achieve (something) without fuss , or without outside help .
( transitive ) To manage to say; to say while fighting back embarrassment , laughter , etc.
( transitive ) To train (a horse ) in the manège ; to exercise in graceful or artful action .
( obsolete , transitive ) To treat with care ; to husband .
( obsolete , transitive ) To bring about ; to contrive .
